Carry Over RUU KUHP, Ini Pasal-pasal yang Akan Dibahas Pemerintah-DPR
04 Nov 2019, 20:31 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - Pemerintah bersama DPR akan membuka kembali pembahasan RUU KUHP yang telah di-carry over. Pembahasan RUU KUHP akan dimungkinkan masuk dalam skala prioritas DPR.
"Nanti kita lihat skala prioritasnya, kita diskusikan. Kita akan diskusikan carry over. Kan ada beberapa UU yang hanya karena perbedaan persepsi dan ketidaktahuan. Seperti di KUHP kan ada yang karena kesalahpahaman. Tapi namun begitu kita akan buka kemungkinan itu," kata Menkum HAM Yasonna Laoly di gedung DPR, Senayan, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).
Karena itu lah, kata Yasonna, pemerintah bersama DPR akan membuka kembali pembahasan pasal-pasal yang masih menjadi perdebatan. Ia meminta masyarakat tidak berprasangka buruk terlebih dulu terhadap pembahasan RUU tersebut.
"Ya (dibuka ruang pembahasan) tapi hanya yang kritis itu aja, yang kritis aja kita bahas kembali. Iya kalau kamu suruh buka kembali sampai ke belakang, sampai hari raya kuda tidak akan sampai selesai itu," ujar Yasonna.
"Kita lihat pembahasan apanya. Dan kita akan betul-betul, dan kita mintakan masyarakat itu jangan suuzan. Yang dulu itu kan ada lah sedikit politiknya, ya kan, bikin rame-rame dikit lah, ya kan. Kalau sekarang kan sudah cooling down," imbuhnya.
Selain itu, Yasonna menyebut pemerintah juga masih membuka ruang untuk mengubah pasal-pasal tertentu dengan perubahan yang rasional. Terkait Komisi III DPR yang menargetkan pembahasan RUU KUHP selesai di bulan Desember, Yasonna mengatakan pembahasannya baru akan dimulai setelah pembahasan prolegnas.
"Prolegnasnya aja belum. Prolegnas itu kita selesaikan sebelum tanggal 12 (Desember) reses, berarti praktisnya Januari dong mulai bicara. Iya dong, mana bisa ujug-ujug aja. Tapi dia bedanya, kalau tidak carry over, dia harus back to square one (pembahasan kembali ke titik awal). Ini kan bukan back to square one. Kita geser dikit ke dia titik yang kontroversial terakhir. Kalau digeser ke square one, lima tahun lagi tidak selesai dan nanti ribut lagi. Kalau memuaskan seluruh rakyat Indonesia tidak mungkin," jelasnya.

Carry Over the Criminal Code Bill, These Articles Will Be Discussed by the Government-DPR
04 Nov 2019, 20:31 by Nur Azizah Rizki Astuti
Jakarta - The government together with the DPR will reopen the discussion of the Criminal Code Bill that has been carried over. Discussion of the Criminal Code Bill will be possible to be included in the DPR priority scale.
"Later we will look at the priority scale, we will discuss it. We will discuss carry over. There are several laws that are only due to differences in perception and ignorance. Like in the Criminal Code there are those who are due to misunderstandings. But however we will open the possibility," said the Minister of Law and Human Rights. Yasonna Laoly at the Parliament building, Senayan, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019).
Because of that, Yasonna said, the government and the DPR will reopen the discussion of articles that are still being debated. He asked the public not to prejudice the discussion of the bill first.
"Yes (the discussion room was opened) but only the critical ones, we will discuss the critical ones again. Yes, if you are told to open it back to the back, until the feast of horses will not finish it," said Yasonna.
"We will see what the discussion is. And we will really, and we ask the people not to suuzan. The first one was there was a little politics, right, make it a little bit busy, right. If it's now cooling down, "he added.
In addition, Yasonna said the government also still opened space to amend certain articles with rational changes. Regarding DPR's Commission III which targets the discussion of the Criminal Code Bill to be completed in December, Yasonna said that the discussion would only begin after the discussion of the National Legislation Program.
"We haven't finished the procedure. We completed it before the 12th (December) recess, which means that practically January started talking. the discussion goes back to square one.) This is not back to square one. We will move it to the last controversial point. If it is shifted to square one, it will not be finished in five years and it will be noisy again. If it satisfies all Indonesian people is impossible, " he explained.
